newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.AFRICA LAUNCHES INQUIRY INTO DIAMOND INDUSTRY.
newsitem.headline: S.AFRICA LAUNCHES INQUIRY INTO DIAMOND INDUSTRY.

text.p: South Africa said on Wednesday that it had appointed a Commission of Inquiry into its diamond industry.
The commission, appointed by South African president Nelson Mandela, will investigate and report on several aspects of the industry.
These include diamond industry legislation, the role of the South African Diamond Board and the effectiveness of illegal diamond buying provisions.

The commission will also look at the supply of rough diamonds to the local processing industry, the industry's contribution to state revenue and job creation, international models relevant to the local industry and the influence of foreign companies and international diamond combines.

The commission, which will begin sitting on February 19 in Johannesburg, will also make recommendations to the Minister of Minerals and Energy on the issues discussed and the best ways to make the industry more competitive.
